docs.title: Welcome to SniderCode
docs.text:
I'm a 43-year-old ECET graduate self-learning to code 1–2 hours every day.

This site documents my progress and provides me with a sense of accountability.

My main aim is to produce robust, resilient and reliable code.

Consistent effort is my main method.

Currently learning: Python → Basics via the book: Python Crash Course

docs.title: About Me
docs.text:
Hi, I'm Jay Snider (@Pycelium on GitHub) — a 43-year-old electronics engineer who decided to become a full-stack developer.

I study 1–2 hours every single day, no excuses. This site is my public log of everything I learn: the wins, the bugs, the “why did that take 4 hours” moments, and every project I ship.

Background - Degree in Electronics Engineering - 20+ years tinkering with hardware - Now obsessed with Python, Django, and building things people actually use

Goal Go from zero to paid freelance / remote dev job in 2026.

Stick around — let’s build this together.

docs.title: Week 1 – Python Basics
docs.text: This week I officially started my coding journey with Python Crash Course (3rd edition) by Eric Matthes.

docs.title: What I Learned
docs.text:
• How to install Python and set up VS Code
  • Variables and basic data types (str, int, float, bool)
  • String methods: .upper(), .title(), .strip()
  • f-strings (my new best friend)
  • Lists: creating, indexing, appending, and slicing
  • Basic for loops and the range() function
